nextSteps.title: Next Steps
nextSteps.subtitle: Continue your journey with these resources
nextSteps.completeMessage: Complete the previous sections to see your personalized action plan
nextSteps.personalizedToDoStay: A personalized to-do list for {childName} to improve opportunities in {town}
nextSteps.personalizedToDoMove: A personalized to-do list for {childName}'s move to {town}
nextSteps.reviewChoicesDetails: Take time to reflect on these choices and discuss with your family
nextSteps.reviewChoicesExplanation: Involving your whole family in the decision-making process ensures everyone feels heard and increases the likelihood of a successful transition. This is especially important for children who may feel anxious about changes.
nextSteps.createCalendar: Create a calendar with important dates and deadlines
nextSteps.createCalendarDetails: Set reminders for application deadlines, school visits, and community program registrations
nextSteps.createCalendarExplanation: Opportunity windows often have specific timelines. Creating a calendar helps you stay organized and ensures you don't miss important deadlines for school applications, program registrations, or housing opportunities.
nextSteps.exploreTownshipResources: Explore resources, community events, and local initiatives
nextSteps.townshipWebsiteExplanation: Township websites often contain valuable information about local programs, initiatives, and resources that aren't advertised elsewhere. Many offer newsletters you can subscribe to for regular updates.
nextSteps.researchSchoolOptions: Research school transfer options in your area
nextSteps.prepareSchoolQuestions: Prepare questions about curriculum, extracurricular activities, and the transfer process
nextSteps.schoolQualityExplanation: School quality is one of the biggest factors in a child's future opportunities. Even within the same district, different schools may offer vastly different resources and programs.
nextSteps.exploreCommunityPrograms: Explore community programs in your area
nextSteps.lookForProgramDetails: Look for registration dates, costs, and program schedules
nextSteps.communityProgramsExplanation: Community programs provide additional support, enrichment, and opportunities that supplement what schools offer. These programs can help develop skills, confidence, and social connections that improve future outcomes.
nextSteps.meetCoordinators: Meet program coordinators and see facilities in person
nextSteps.inPersonVisitsExplanation: In-person visits give you a much better sense of the environment and quality of programs than websites or brochures can provide. They also demonstrate your interest, which can be helpful for competitive programs.
nextSteps.connectWithParents: Connect with other parents in your community
nextSteps.joinParentGroups: Join local parent groups, school PTAs, or neighborhood associations
nextSteps.parentNetworksExplanation: Parent networks are invaluable sources of information, support, and advocacy. Other parents can share insider knowledge about schools, programs, and resources that may not be widely advertised.
nextSteps.identifyAdvocacyWays: Identify ways to advocate for better opportunities
nextSteps.attendTownMeetings: Attend town meetings, connect with local representatives, or join advocacy groups
nextSteps.communityAdvocacyExplanation: Community advocacy has been shown to improve local services and opportunities. When parents organize and advocate together, they can create significant positive changes in schools and community resources.
nextSteps.compareHousingOptions: Compare costs, neighborhoods, and proximity to schools and amenities
nextSteps.housingLocationExplanation: Housing location significantly impacts access to quality schools, safe environments, and community resources. Research shows that moving to a high-opportunity neighborhood can improve children's lifetime outcomes.
nextSteps.exploreNeighborhood: Explore the neighborhood, visit schools, and get a feel for the community
nextSteps.visitingInPersonExplanation: Visiting in person helps you assess factors that don't show up in statistics: community feel, safety, noise levels, and whether the neighborhood is a good fit for your family's lifestyle and needs.
nextSteps.gatherEnrollmentInfo: Gather information about enrollment requirements, deadlines, and documentation needed
nextSteps.schoolEnrollmentExplanation: Schools may have specific enrollment windows, documentation requirements, or waitlists. Contacting them early gives you time to prepare and increases your chances of securing a spot.
nextSteps.exploreNewAreaPrograms: Explore community programs in the new area
nextSteps.lookForRegistrationDates: Look for registration dates, costs, and program schedules
nextSteps.communityProgramsSupportExplanation: Community programs provide additional support and enrichment beyond school. They help children build skills, make friends, and develop a sense of belonging in their new community.
nextSteps.createMovingPlan: Create a detailed moving plan and timeline
nextSteps.includeMovingSteps: Include housing search, school transfers, and community program registrations
nextSteps.movingPlanExplanation: Moving involves many steps that need to be coordinated. A detailed plan helps ensure nothing falls through the cracks during this complex transition.
nextSteps.developMovingBudget: Develop a budget for the move
nextSteps.considerMovingCosts: Consider housing costs, moving expenses, and potential changes in cost of living
nextSteps.movingBudgetExplanation: Moving often involves significant costs beyond just housing. Planning for these expenses helps prevent financial stress that could undermine the benefits of relocating.
nextSteps.identifyLocalResources: Identify local resources for new families
nextSteps.findWelcomeCenters: Find welcome centers, family support services, and newcomer programs
nextSteps.localResourcesExplanation: Many communities have resources specifically designed to help new families integrate and thrive. These can ease the transition and help you quickly build connections in your new community.
nextSteps.contactAgentsHousingType: Contact real estate agents about {housingType} options
nextSteps.contactAgentsHousing: Contact real estate agents about housing options
nextSteps.prepareHousingQuestions: Prepare questions about availability, pricing, and financing options
nextSteps.realEstateAgentsExplanation: Local real estate agents have valuable insights about neighborhoods, school districts, and housing trends that may not be obvious online. They can also help you navigate the local market more effectively.

additionalResources.title: Additional Resources
additionalResources.subtitle: Tools and resources to help prepare for college and beyond
additionalResources.testPrepDescription: Free and low-cost resources to help prepare for the SAT, ACT, and other standardized tests
additionalResources.scholarshipsDescription: Find scholarships, grants, and other financial assistance for college
additionalResources.onlineCoursesDescription: Free educational resources to build skills and prepare for college-level work
additionalResources.collegeApplicationsDescription: Resources for navigating the college application process
additionalResources.tipEarly: Start preparing early - ideally by freshman year of high school
additionalResources.tipResearch: Research colleges that match your academic profile, interests, and financial situation
additionalResources.tipVisit: Visit campuses when possible to get a feel for the environment
additionalResources.tipMentors: Connect with mentors who can provide guidance through the process

community.title: Community Connections
community.subtitle: Connect with others on their journey to better opportunities
community.testimonialSubmitMessage: Thank you for sharing your story! Your testimonial will be reviewed and published soon.

testimonialsContent.marcus: Moving to a higher opportunity neighborhood completely changed our lives. My children now attend excellent schools, and we've connected with supportive community programs. This website guided us through the entire process!
testimonialsContent.elena: As a single father, I was overwhelmed by the prospect of moving to provide better opportunities for my kids. The resources and step-by-step guidance here made it manageable. We've been in our new community for 6 months, and my children are thriving.
testimonialsContent.david: Instead of moving, we decided to stay and advocate for better resources in our community. The action plan helped us connect with local organizations and other parents. We've already seen improvements in our neighborhood schools!
testimonialsContent.jane: The opportunity map was eye-opening. We had no idea how much variation existed between neighborhoods so close to each other. We made an informed decision to move, and now my daughter has access to amazing STEM programs she loves.

neighborhoodAnalysis.title: Neighborhood Analysis
neighborhoodAnalysis.subtitle: Explore the quality of life in this area
neighborhoodAnalysis.enterAddress: Enter your address to see neighborhood analysis
neighborhoodAnalysis.scoreDescription: This score represents the economic mobility potential for children in this area.
